text: Tagetes stenophylla is a Mexican species of marigolds in the sunflower family. It has been found in the States of Guerrero, Jalisco, Morelos, Michoacán, and México State in western and central Mexico.Turner, B. L. 1996. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 6. Tageteae and Athemideae. Phytologia Memoirs. 10: i–ii, 1–22, 43–93 Tagetes stenophylla is a hairless, branching perennial herb up to 100 cm (40 inches) tall. Leaves are highly divided, up to 4 cm (1.6 inches) long, the leaves high on the stem reduced to branching threads. The plant one flower head per flower stalk, are yellow, each head containing 5 ray florets surrounding numerous disc florets.Rydberg, Per Axel 1913. in Britton, Nathaniel Lord, North American Flora 34: 153 ==References== ==External links== *photo of herbarium specimen collected in Michoacán in 1939 stenophylla Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Plants described in 1907
